clinical_study.brief_title: Suture of UTerus and Ultrasound Repair Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial Comparing Three Techniques of Uterine Closure on the Myometrium Thickness Evaluated With Ultrasound Six Months After a Primary Cesarean

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares three techniques of uterine closure on myometrium thickness evaluated by ultrasound six months after the primary cesarean. The three techniques include: 1) locked single layer closure; 2) double layer closure with a first continuous locked suture and a second imbricating continuous suture; 3) double layer closure with a first continuous unlocked suture of the deep portion of the myometrium avoiding the inclusion of the decidua and a second unlocked continuous suture that approximate the upper portion of the myometrium. The primary outcome is the mean myometrium thickness at the site of the uterine scar evaluated by transvaginal ultrasound at six months after cesarean.

primary_outcome.description: Using transvaginal ultrasound the residual myometrium thickness at the site of the uterine scar will be measure.

arm_group.description: Double layer closure with a first continuous unlocked suture of the deep portion of the myometrium avoiding the inclusion of the decidua and a second unlocked continuous suture that approximate the upper portion of the myometrium.
As reported in Williams Obstetrics textbook
Double layer closure with a first continuous locked suture and a second imbricating continuous suture.

intervention.intervention_name: Closure of the hysterotomy at the time of primary cesarean

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Planned cesarean
- Primary cesarean
- ≥ 38 gestational weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous cesarean
- Women < 18 years old
- Multiple gestation
- Mullerian anomalies
- Active labor
- Diabetes
- BMI >35 kg/m2
- Placenta praevia
- Chronic systemic disease
